definition: ostrich policy (sticking one's head in the sand, failing to acknowledge danger)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy

sentences.english: President and First Lady adopts the ostrich policy, hides does not come out in the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 总统和第一夫人采取鸵鸟政策，躲在卧室里不出来。

sentences.english: Both manufacturing and services suffer from head-in-the-sand attitudes in the finance industry.
sentences.chinese: 制造业和服务业都惨遭金融业鸵鸟政策的毒害。

sentences.english: This ostrich policy was brought into derision.
sentences.chinese: 这种鸵鸟政策受到嘲笑。

definition: to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
to use one's neighbor as a drain/to shift one's problems onto others (idiom)
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
dare not go one step beyond the prescribed limit
pinyin: bu4 gan3 yue4 Lei2 chi2 yi1 bu4

definition: the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1

definition: hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
